title: Systems and center of mass - balancing an L

content.question: A uniform sheet of cardboard is cut into an “<math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi></math>” shape as shown. One end of string is attached at point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, and the object is held vertically at rest by the string. Which of the following diagrams best represents this rest position as the shape is supported by the string?

choices.label: The figure shows the cardboard sheet, with the vertical section tilted downward and to the left, and the horizontal section tilted downward and to the right.
The figure shows the cardboard sheet, with the vertical section tilted downward and to the right, and the horizontal section tilted upward and to the right.
The figure shows the cardboard sheet in its original orientation.
The figure shows the cardboard sheet, with the vertical section tilted downward and significantly to the left, and the horizontal section tilted significantly downward and to the right.

content.answer: The figure shows the cardboard sheet, with the vertical section tilted downward and to the left, and the horizontal section tilted downward and to the right.
